value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">10</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">......</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The writer then came to birth with difficulty in</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">England; for so long as familiar letters are written in</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Biblical prose there are limits to his freedom; a barrier</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">between the sayable and the unsayable. He is in being;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">for the printing press has given him a name; but still</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">unspecialised, undifferentiated. The artist is not wholly</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>write</sic>
              <corr>writer</corr>
            </choice>, wholly musician, or wholly painter. It seems</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">possible that the great English art may not be the art of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">words. His eye is stimulated by the colour of the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">of the 
            <choice>
              <sic>clotning</sic>
              <corr>clothing</corr>
            </choice>, of the pageantry. his ear by the sound of</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">words spoken aloud. <add hand="ms" place="above">For books were read aloud.</add> <quote source="#" rend="inline">"
            <choice>
              <sic>Prtitachrd</sic>
              <corr>Pritchard</corr>
            </choice>"</quote> wrote <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-aclif" key="Clifford, Ann">Lady Ann Clifford</rs></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#">"read aloud the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-faer" key="Faerie Queene, The">Faery Queen</rs>..... They read aloud <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-mmon" key="Montaigne, Michel de">
            <choice>
              <sic>Montage</sic>
              <corr>Montaigne</corr>
            </choice></rs></quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">and the Faery Queen."</quote> Every word was given sharpness and</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">substance by the speaking voice. And the lute, the cithern,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the old full bodied instrument that still stands on a</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>ches</sic>
              <corr>chest</corr>
            </choice>, 
            <choice>
              <sic>hgave</sic>
              <corr>gave</corr>
            </choice> lilt, rhythm, melody to the word.</l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="inline">
            <l>"Hardly one lighter or boat in 
              <choice>
                <sic>hree</sic>
                <corr>three</corr>
              </choice> that had the goods</l>
            <l>of a house in it , but there was a pair of virginals in</l>
          </quote>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#">it"</quote> <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-spep" key="Pepys, Samuel">Pepys</rs> observed in 1666 when the people of London were</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">loading their goods onto boats to escape from the fire of</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">London. His mind the was full of undifferentiated words, 
            <choice>
              <sic>ole</sic>
              <corr>old</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">words and new words; French and Latin. No grammar bound them</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">tightly together. They were elastic; they could be danced to</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and sung to. But they could not follow the pace of the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>spea ing</sic>
              <corr>speaking</corr>
            </choice> voice.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-espe" key="Spenser, Edmund">Spenser</rs> then in the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-faer" key="Faerie Queene, The">Faery Queen</rs> is like a</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">half articulate monster rising from the depths of 
            <choice>
              <sic>silnce</sic>
              <corr>silence</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">hung with the weeds and pearls of the deep sea in</l>
